;In February 2022, wild boar warning signs were eye-catching at the foothills of Zijin Mountain in Zhongshan Scenic Area, Nanjing. Visual China

;

;The wild boar was eventually trapped in a river that was more than 3 meters wide and about 200 meters long.

;

;At noon on November 29, 2023, this wild boar appeared in Jianye District, Nanjing City from about 5 a.m., which had caused a lot of commotion, and was finally driven by the police to this small road called Nanhubei. In the ditch.

;

;On the left bank there is a low lawn first, and then there is a palm bush about one meter above. The wild boar is hiding under the palm bush for a while. Dozens of special police officers and auxiliary police officers stood ready with shields and explosion-proof steel forks. Two staff members who came from the Hongshan Zoo Wildlife Conservation and Rescue Center were about 2 meters away from it and prepared anesthetic drugs urgently.

;

;Many onlookers were already standing on the road on the right bank of the river. In the video shot by a netizen, a delivery man in the crowd heard an order notification on his phone, but his voice was pressed down, and no one left; another man was holding a bag of persimmons in his hand, standing still and watching; a woman was walking her dog Passing by, I couldn't stop looking towards the river and started to stop.

;

;“Residents have never seen anything new like this, and neither have we.” Wei Zhennan, deputy director of the Yiyuan Community Neighborhood Committee in Jianye District, Nanjing, told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;In Nanjing, wild boars are the most frequent wild animals. Nanjing municipal government departments have stated that they will formulate and improve contingency plans for wild boar police situations, do a good job in emergency response, and carry out scientific and effective hunting and driving of wild boars. Work. But for Wei Zhennan, he had never seen such a large-scale hunting of wild boars.

;

;Catching wild boars

;

;Previous media reported that this wild boar appeared on a campus in Jianye District, Nanjing at around 5 a.m. on November 29. After the security guard found out, he was worried that the wild boar might hurt someone, so he called the police for help. After receiving the call, Nanjing Jianye police went to the scene to search for the wild boars. The wild boars began to rush out of the school and fled in all directions.

;

;A staff member of Beilei Community in Nanhu Street told Southern Weekend reporters that it was six or seven in the morning when the wild boars arrived in the community, and they had not yet gone to work. "I heard that they visited several communities." . According to media reports, a security guard in Beilei Community was knocked down and bitten by a wild boar and was sent to the hospital for six stitches. The above-mentioned staff said they had gone to express condolences to the injured security guard, but did not disclose the extent of the injury.

;

;In Yiyuan Community, it was already past nine o'clock in the morning when Wei Zhennan received a call from the property management company. The other party informed residents that wild boars were found in the area. "I thought it was a small wild boar at the time." Wei Zhennan still found it strange. After checking the surveillance with the community police, he found that at 7 o'clock in the morning, the wild boar was already wandering around the community. In the surveillance video, the wild boar was very muscular, weighing more than 200 kilograms, "so the police quickly requested support."

;

;By the time Wei Zhennan arrived at the hiding place of the wild boar, the police in Jianye District had already begun to raise alert and prepare to round him up.

;

;At nearly 11 o'clock, Li Feng (pseudonym), an animal protection worker at the Hongshan Zoo Wildlife Conservation and Rescue Center, received a call from the 110 police center and hurried to the scene. For Li Feng, this is part of his daily work. Every day he receives five or six calls for help from wild animals, involving birds, snakes, wild boars, etc.

;

;Injecting anesthesia into wild boars has certain risks. Under normal circumstances, Li Fengfeng works with his colleagues. One person injects the injection (using an anesthesia blowpipe to inject the injection from a distance), and the other person assists in preparing the anesthetic drugs. The optimal distance for injection is 3-5 meters. Li Feng explained that if it is far away, the injection cannot penetrate the pig skin and the anesthetic will take effect slowly; if it is too close, the risk to the staff increases. Wild boars react much faster than humans. Once, a wild boar was frightened after being injected with anesthesia, and the staff chased it for nearly two kilometers.

;

;This time on the river bank in South Hubei, Li Feng held an anesthesia blowpipe, crouched under a palm bush, then slowly poked his head out, aiming at the wild boar. The first anesthesia needle was injected into the head and neck of the wild boar. The wild boar suddenly emerged from the palm bushes, knocked away the policeman on the side, and rushed wildly along the river.

;

;The crowd of onlookers immediately surged. The police and community workers quickly raised their voices and evacuated the onlookers. It’s okay.”

;

;In the video captured by the media, the wild boar ran for hundreds of meters and then swam back from the river. Li Feng took advantage of the wild boar to swim ashore and subsequently injected three more anesthetics. Li Feng estimated that the anesthesia took effect in about half an hour, and the wild boar was blocked under the bridge tunnel and brought to the shore. However, because the wild boar choked on water after being anesthetized, it was dying when it came ashore and died on the way to Hongshan Zoo.

;

;After local media released a live video of the wild boar being captured, netizens suspected that it was the previous "river-crossing pig" that took 12 minutes to cross the Yangtze River and land in Nanjing on November 27. When crossing the river, Yao Chengyu, the duty leader of the Nanjing Maritime Safety Administration's Vessel Traffic Management Center, spotted it on the surveillance camera and watched it flexibly avoid many large ships and pass at high speed on the water.

;

;Tang Xiaofan, director of the Party and Mass Work Department of the Nanjing Maritime Safety Administration, said that although there were many ships passing up and down the waterway at that time, compared to large ships of 70 to 80 meters, the wild boar collision would not cause damage to the ship. It is easy to die in itself. For the staff of the Maritime Safety Administration, it is rare for large wild animals such as wild boars to appear on the river. More common are finless porpoises, birds and other wild animals. In terms of wildlife protection, they mainly cooperate with the Nanjing municipal government departments in delineating ecological reserves, banning navigation in ecological reserves, and reducing water pollution in the Yangtze River. They do not need to deal with wild boar traffic accidents.

;

;After the rescue

;

;Southern Weekend reporters found that in November 2023 alone, there were many incidents of wild boars in Nanjing.

;

;On November 1, a woman in Jiangning District, Nanjing, encountered a wild boar while sitting in front of a restaurant and quickly fled into the restaurant. The owner of the restaurant said that the aunt in the restaurant who was harassed was not bitten. The wild boar quickly left on its own and they did not call the police. On November 10, the media reported that Mr. Zhou, a Nanjing citizen, collided with a wild boar while driving, and his vehicle was damaged. Mr. Zhou told Southern Weekend reporters that the wild boar injured its legs after being hit, and passers-by called the Hongshan Zoo Wildlife Conservation and Rescue Center to have it towed away. Later, Mr. Zhou’s friend asked about the wild boar’s treatment and learned that the wild boar could not be saved.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters called the Nanjing Municipal Public Security Bureau several times on December 1 to inquire about the wild boar police situation, but failed to receive a reply. On the website of the Nanjing Municipal Government, Southern Weekend reporters searched and found a reply posted on July 5, 2022, from the Nanjing Municipal Landscaping Bureau to the Nanjing Municipal People’s Congress meeting’s recommendations on the disposal of wild boars in rural areas.

;

;The reply mentioned that in recent years, due to the improvement of the ecological environment, the number of wild boars in Nanjing has increased rapidly, and their activity range has continued to expand. They are found in Laoshan, Niushou Mountain, Wuxiang Mountain in the suburbs, and even in the main urban area. Wild boars are out and about. News of wild boars leaving the mountains and forests and frequently entering tourist attractions, parks, traffic arteries, residential areas, shopping malls, campuses, etc., destroying crops, damaging facilities, and even causing personal injury, disrupting the normal order of production and life of citizens, has become a major issue affecting cities. One of the security risks.

;

;From January to May 2022, the Nanjing Municipal Public Security Bureau received a total of 201 reports involving wild boars, covering multiple administrative districts in the city. They were mainly traffic accidents in which wild boars caused vehicle damage and injuries, and wild boar infestations. wait. Faced with this kind of police situation, the local public security organs will dispatch personnel to the scene as soon as possible to deal with it. If the situation is critical and may threaten the personal safety of citizens, after on-site assessment and other standardized procedures, the offending wild boar will be shot and followed up in accordance with the law. Work.

;

;Li Feng remembers that throughout 2022, the number of wild boars rescued by Hongshan Zoo was 32, and that number will be reduced by about ten in 2023. He thinks it may be related to the removal of wild boar from the "Three You" protected animal list. In July 2023, the State Forestry and Grassland Administration officially released the adjusted "List of Terrestrial Wild Animals with Important Ecological, Scientific, and Social Values". Wild boars are not included in the list. This means that wild boars are no longer protected animals, and the hunting procedures for wild boars have been further simplified.

;

;Li Feng suggested that citizens should not panic if they encounter a wild boar on the street or in a park. If the wild boar does not hurt anyone, just stay away from it. If there is an emergency that injures people or disturbs residents' lives, citizens can call the police or call the Wildlife Rescue Center. Hongshan Zoo will make an assessment after rescuing wild animals. The exotic species will be kept in the park, while about 40% of the native species will be released into the wild. "This success rate is quite high," Li Feng said. It needs to be taken into consideration. Various accidents are prone to occur during the rescue of wild animals. For example, a wild boar accidentally drowned after being anesthetized in the Beihe River in South Hubei.

;

;Li Feng specifically mentioned a wild boar rescued from Bazishan Park in 2022. The wild boar has become so docile as a result of being raised by humans for a long time that people can even pet it. Hongshan Zoo was worried that it would not survive in the wild, so it has been kept in the zoo. "Some tourists are not clear. They think that feeding these animals is to protect them, but in fact they are harming them." Li Feng and his team also rescued two wild boars that had been fed near the Sun Yat-sen Mausoleum in 2023, but they were ultimately unable to be released into the wild.

;

;Faced with the increasing number of wild boars, Nanjing has taken measures such as strengthening population monitoring and investigation, strengthening prevention and publicity and guidance of wild boar activities. In addition, the Nanjing Municipal Landscaping and Greening Bureau has also adopted wild boar population control methods.

;

;The above-mentioned reply from the Nanjing Municipal Landscaping and Greening Bureau mentioned that Nanjing will launch a pilot wild boar hazard prevention and control work in the Zijin Mountain area starting from October 2021. After expert evaluation and demonstration, the wild boar population density in the Zijin Mountain monitoring area has exceeded the control standard. The Nanjing Municipal Greening and Gardening Bureau applied to the Provincial Forestry Bureau for a hunting quota of 60 wild boars, and issued an administrative license for hunting wild boars to the Zhongshan Cemetery Administration Bureau. From March 22, 2022 to March 15, 2023, it will be carried out in the Zijin Mountain area Wild boar population regulation.

;

;Li Feng believes that in recent years, the public’s awareness of wildlife protection has increased, and citizens will take the initiative to call for help when encountering wild animals that are trapped or causing accidents. In 2022, Hongshan Zoo rescued about 1,200 animals. "A wild boar is just a little wave."

;Li Heming, researcher at Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center

; < p style="text-align: left;">;Three years later, the domestic credit card market will open up to the outside world again.

;

;On November 19, 2023, the international credit card organization giant MasterCard’s holding company in China, MasterCard, obtained a bank card clearing business license and stated that Within 6 months, it will expand its member institutions in China and authorize the issuance and acceptance of MasterCard brand bank cards.

;

;This is a time when China’s credit card market is shifting from a race-and-spur rush to intensive farming. At the same time, China's credit card market as a whole faces the challenges of rising non-performing loan ratios and shrinking new card issuance volumes.

;

;As the second largest personal credit market after housing mortgage loans, how do commercial banks respond to the new situation of credit cards, a high-quality asset? Which card issuing bank has better risk management system and risk control effect? Which card issuer is more effective at retaining customers?

;

;Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center hereby conducts a multi-dimensional evaluation of the credit card business of 20 systemically important banks.

;

;Five dimensions, 12 sub-indicators

;

;Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center based on the public disclosure information related to credit card business of 20 banks in 2023. Based on this, the 2023 Credit Card Performance Ranking Index Evaluation System has been constructed. Consistent with the wealth management list, green finance list, digital finance list, data security list and life insurance efficiency list, the credit card quality and efficiency list indicator system designed by Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center is mainly based on quantitative and qualitative indicators, supplemented by external expert review and media factor.

;

;Among them, the quantitative and qualitative indicators include three major dimensions: business scale and growth, risk management, customer service and product innovation, with 12 sub-indicators, each sub-indicator. Indicators are given differential weights based on their importance. The total weight of quantitative and qualitative indicators is 70%. Among quantitative and qualitative indicators, business scale accounts for as much as 35%.

;

;Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center also invited 7 external authoritative experts to conduct an independent real-name review and scoring based on the overall understanding of each bank's credit card business, with a weight of 15%. At the same time, in order to encourage commercial banks to improve the transparency of information disclosure in the credit card field, the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center formed a media factor based on the feedback of 20 banks' credit card business on a special survey, with a weight of 15%.

;

;
;

;

;;

;

;Credit card quality and efficiency ranking indicator system (Liang Shuyi, Liu Yuyu/picture)

;

;

;

;Pay equal attention to scale, risk control and innovation

;

;The various dimensions of the credit card quality and efficiency list and the set quantitative and qualitative indicators below are explained as follows:

; < p style="text-align: left;">;(1) Business scale is an important reflection of the credit card strength of major banks. There are six sub-indicators under this dimension, namely the number of credit card issuances and their changes, credit card loan balances and their proportions, the number of credit card users, and the amount of credit card transactions. The total weight of the six sub-indicators is 35%.

;

;(2) Risk management is a necessary dimension to examine the comprehensive strength of each bank's credit card. There are three sub-indicators under this dimension, namely credit card non-performing loan balance, non-performing loan ratio and their changes. The total weight of the three sub-indicators is 18%. Among them, in order to highlight the efforts and effects of banks in controlling the non-performing loan ratio, based on the credit card loan non-performing ratio indicator, a change rate indicator of the credit card loan non-performing ratio is set to directly reflect the results of the measures taken by each bank.

;

;(3) Customer service and product innovation are inevitable choices for major banks to cope with the increasingly fierce competition in the credit card market. There are three sub-indicators under this dimension, namely bank card fee income, credit card complaints volume and their changes. The total weight of the three sub-indicators is 17%. Among them, the number of complaints about the credit card business and its changes can prove the customer's recognition of the bank's credit card business and is a negative indicator; bank card fee income directly reflects the use of the bank's credit cards in real transactions, thereby reflecting the bank's Credit card product innovation and customer service levels.

;

;Joint stock banks dominate the top three

;

;Comprehensive analysis of the quantitative and qualitative indicators, expert reviews and media factor scores of 20 banks, Southern Weekend New Financial Research The center has constructed the 2023 credit card quality and efficiency list.

;

;
;

;

;;

;

;Credit card quality and efficiency list (Liang Shuyi, Liu Yuyu/picture)

;

;

;

;The credit card quality and efficiency list shows that China Merchants Bank, China CITIC Bank and Guangfa Bank took the top three overall scores.

;

;China Merchants Bank ranks first in quantitative and qualitative indicators, expert review scores and media factors, and is the only company to receive "double perfect scores" from expert reviews and media factors. Bank of. The bank won the championship with a large lead of 12 points, which reflects the competitiveness of the bank's credit cards in all aspects such as business, finance and reputation.

;

;CITIC Bank narrowly defeated China Guangfa Bank with a slight advantage of 0.24 points. The two joint-stock banks ranked second and third in the credit card quality and efficiency list respectively. Together with Ping An Bank, which ranks fourth, in the 2023 new financial competitiveness sub-list released this time, the credit card quality and efficiency list is also the only sub-list in which a joint-stock bank has achieved the top four rankings.

;

;Although external review scores and media factors have partially weakened the influence of scale indicators on the list, only from the perspective of quantitative and qualitative indicator performance, China Merchants Bank, CITIC and GF The score is still in the top three. Among them, Guangfa Bank's credit card loan balance accounts for as high as 48% of the bank's personal loan balance, far exceeding its peers. This proves that the credit card business has a huge influence on the bank beyond its peers. At the same time, despite the overall contraction in credit card issuance, China CITIC Bank and China Guangfa Bank still maintained positive growth in card issuance, which also shows the considerable strength of the two joint-stock banks in the credit card business.

;

;The five major banks ranked among the top ten

;

;Although they were not among the top three, the five major banks of the China Construction Bank of China, Workers and Peasants, all ranked among the top ten, still showing that overseas There are major banks with overall strength in the credit card business. The credit card business of major state-owned banks started early and has a huge customer base. It has always been significantly ahead in the scale of credit card business. However, in recent years, with the fluctuation of credit card asset quality and the stricter supervision after the implementation of new credit card regulations, a large number of invalid and inefficient credit cards issued in the early stage have withdrawn from the market. In the midst of this ebb and flow, the scale advantages of large banks in various countries are gradually being eliminated.

;

;The credit card business is not as important to large state-owned banks as it is to joint-stock banks. Looking at the proportion of credit card loans in personal loans, the average proportion of credit card loan balances in the five major banks is 9%, while this indicator for the nine joint-stock banks is as high as 27%. In this sense, despite being at an overall disadvantage in entry time, asset size and customer base, joint-stock banks can occupy half of the credit card market, and their comprehensive competitiveness beyond their opponents is obvious.

;

;Therefore, the ranking of the five major banks in the credit card quality and efficiency list is appropriate.

;

;The leading city commercial banks are catching up

;

;The credit card scores of the five city commercial banks are highly differentiated. Among them, Bank of Ningbo’s comprehensive score is second only to ICBC, ranking 6th.

;

;In the first half of 2023, the bank's credit card issuance volume increased by as much as 40% year-on-year, ranking first among 20 banks; at the same time, the bank's credit card issuance volume increased by 40% year-on-year. The bank's credit card non-performing rate is only 1.19%, the best among peers; while maintaining an ultra-low credit card non-performing rate, the bank's credit card non-performing rate is still on a downward trajectory, which is even more difficult. This reflects that leading city commercial banks are working hard to catch up in the credit card business and have made great progress in some indicators.

;

;Compared to Bank of Ningbo, the other four city commercial banks all rank at the bottom, showing that they still have a clear gap with large and medium-sized banks in terms of comprehensive credit card strength. Affected by factors such as their short time in the credit card market, small business scale, and weak customer base, the four city commercial banks overall lagged behind in indicators such as credit card issuance volume and credit card loan balance.

;

;Half is ocean, half is land

;

;Leizhou Peninsula, at the southernmost tip of mainland China, faces Hainan Island across the sea. The writer Sun Pin came here and stayed for two years.

;

;When we arrived on the island, Sun Pin kept walking and looking, identifying every plant and animal one by one. She talked with local people of different ages and learned some Leizhou dialect. "Eating" means "exemption" and "problem" means "taking responsibility". She tried her best as a northerner to feel the temperament and character of this land and water.

;

;Leizhou Peninsula is filled with "witchcraft" temperament. Tianhou Temple and Mazu Temple can be found everywhere, and there are various other gods in each village. "Faced with such a huge thing as the ocean, human beings cannot help but be in awe and ask for its blessings." The worship of the ocean and the many gods it derives permeates many details of the daily life of people living near the sea. "The folk customs here The folklore is very peculiar, and I was very curious about it, so I had this idea at that time and wanted to write about this land-sea junction."

;

;In the novel collection "The Magician of the Sea" published in 2023, Sun Pin fictionalized a seaside village located at the southernmost tip of Leizhou Peninsula: Papaya Town. The first novel in the collection, "The Magician by the Sea," tells the story of a northerner who comes here to look for her brother who has disappeared for many years. For Sun Pin, searching is a very fascinating process. "You keep moving forward on a road. You don't know what kind of people and what kind of stories you will encounter ahead."

;

;So, this northerner met the old lady who asked her not to scare Jackfruit, "Jackfruit is very attached to people and likes to be touched and praised most"; she met Sister Mei who lived with many plants and animals, and saw her Taking the leaf cake to the grave in the woods, she believed that the ghosts of her family were living in the black cat; she also met a person who looked like a carp spirit. In order to make her believe her words, the carp spirit faced her before speaking. The Mazu statue enshrined in the house burns incense and worships the gods, "If I tell you in front of Mazu, there will be no lies."

;

;"In this small town, many boundaries are blurred. People, plants and animals, living people and dead people, and the ground and the underground can all travel back and forth with each other. All things have animism and live together in a big family..."

;

; "This place still has a barbaric temperament. On one side, it frequently draws out its swords to attack people, causing blood to splatter five feet away. On the other side, it believes in animism. Each village has its own gods, and each god's birthday is different. Similarly, the birthday of the gods is a grand festival for the whole village, collectively called the calendar. Thunder operas must be sung to the gods on the stage, fine wine must be offered to the gods, fresh boiled chicken must be prepared, and firecrackers must be set off all day long. , there is a lion dance, and there is an extremely grand ceremony for the wandering god, while the god just sits in his temple and quietly watches people wishing him a birthday." (;"The Magician on the Beach";)

;

;Nature is the cause and life is the effect. Being with the sea all day long gives the folk life in Leizhou Peninsula an atmosphere of fantasy and mystery, and hidden behind this is the huge powerlessness and loneliness of human beings when facing the ocean.

;

;When Sun Pin saw the sea for the first time, his reaction was no different from that of many inland people, "It's so big that you don't know what is hidden inside." Regarding living on land For people on earth, land means a stable life, walking and living on land, building ancestral halls and ancestral temples, and reproducing from generation to generation. And what is life at sea really like? Facing the huge, mysterious and unknown sea, how should people settle their "rootless" sea life that is destined to wander?

;

;Taking the ferry back and forth from Xuwen Port to Haikou, Sun Pin took a total of more than ten boats and tried to chat with the crew. Crew members are often very silent, especially ocean-going crew members. One or two years of sailing at sea often cause them to lose contact with their friends on land, and people on land gradually forget their existence. "This kind of life on board is separated from the land. They are a world of their own, a world on board." When talking to Sun Pin, a captain called himself a "seaman". She noticed the particularity of this term. "Not a crew member or a sailor, but a seaman." "This distinction is no longer a professional one, but a separation based on the fundamental standpoint of human beings."

;

;This loneliness will eventually Leading to what? Sun Pin discovered that after catching expensive fish, some fishermen would take the money from selling the fish and go to the city center, find a hotel room, eat some delicious food, spend the money and then go back to fishing. She heard that many ocean-going sailors were like this. When the ocean-going ship docked for supplies, they would disembark and desperately buy things. Sun Pin tried to explain the origin of this compensation mentality, "For example, fishermen may die when they go out to sea in a small boat. Under this kind of impermanent fear, once you have a chance to get rid of or relax, you will desperately want to compensate yourself. ." "Or it may be a very simple idea, spend the money as soon as possible, in case I die tomorrow."

;

;The sea is silent, and the people in the sea are silent. The ship is like a natural prison. "Because of the narrow space and its separation from the land, it is likely to become a prison, and the crew will become prisoners, enduring torture-like loneliness." "But, can we change it?" How can we understand it from another perspective? This closed and isolated space can actually be turned into a Thoreau-style cabin, a unique space suitable for philosophical speculation?" In the second chapter of the novel collection "Seagull Knight", Sun Pin fictionalized a The captain wears a suit, combs his hair every day, burns incense, drinks tea, and plays the piano. "He still behaves elegantly in a place where no one is around, just like a ghost duke dormant in an old castle... He is sometimes very easy-going, sometimes very..." He is gloomy and occasionally fierce. When he is in a good mood, he will talk about literature and art elegantly. There is something between noble and gloomy in him."

;

;She wanted to ask, when a person is in a In such a closed and lonely environment, how can we find a broader and richer spiritual space for ourselves?

;

;;

;

;In The Crack of Civilization

;

;Two years ago, Sun Pin's collection of novels "In the Name of Birds and Beasts" was published. Fan Xiaozhe, editor of People's Literature Publishing House, edited Sun Pin's book for the first time. "Whether she writes about the grand and lush plants in the south, the rich aquatic products in the ocean, or the uninhabited dense forests in the north, these things are just the material of Sun Pin's novels," Fan Xiaozhe said, "and in the end all novels point to modern times. Civilization (;Modernization, urbanization;) has an inner impact on people, and at the same time, they are looking back or questioning."

;

;In "In the Name of Birds and Beasts", Sun Pin turns his attention to the mountain people in his hometown of Luliang Mountain. There, modern urban civilization is constantly entering this "barbaric" land. Sun Pin created a mountain man named You Xiaolong. He walked out of the mountains and had a decent civil servant job in the town. But this profession did not provide him with a sense of identity. “His roots are still in the mountains.” In Sun Pin’s view, what You Xiaolong represents is the suffering suffered by some people in the process of urbanization. “They My soul has nowhere to rest, I can’t go back to my hometown, and the city doesn’t belong to me.”

;

;“Don’t you think this is the epitome of a large part of the people in China?” Sun Pin’s voice came from the other end of the phone. came, "Of course, urbanization is a necessary stage in the development of human society. But in fact, every step of development of the times requires the blood and tears of hundreds of millions of people."

;

;The focus on urbanization also continues Go to the third novel in the new collection of novels, "Sunset Coral". In the novel, Sun Pin meticulously recorded the urbanization process of Papaya Town: in the 1980s, 100,000 talents came to Hainan, and all the people in Papaya Town became small traders; in the 1990s, the Wenzhou real estate speculators allowed smuggled cars to invade and devour the entire town. And when the tourism and vacation trend started in Hainan Island, Papaya Town rushed to operate a coral B&B... Between the city and the countryside, Sun Pin once again chose the gap between civilizations as the perspective of her thinking. The protagonist "I" in the novel once walked from Papaya Town to the city. "I originally went to pursue modern civilization, but I could never really enter the city."

;

;From north to south, from the mountains and forests to the sea, in the literary geography Under the changes of migration, Sun Pin always paid attention to the spiritual state that is not limited by geography, that has a certain universal "solitude" - the personal spirit that is difficult to place in the gap between modern civilization and the turmoil of the times. Therefore, what Fan Xiaozhe said about "looking back" not only constitutes the writer's fundamental questioning of modern civilization, but also Sun Pin's inner connection with his own life experience.

;

;For Sun Pin, the "post-80s" generation, she feels that every change in the times has an impact on her and her generation. She witnessed workers being laid off during her childhood. As a teenager, she became a "hard-working problem solver in a small town." "By the time I graduated, the sense of superiority that still existed among college students in the 1990s had disappeared, and college students had turned into grains of dust." When she was in college, she would still think, "We have entered the 21st century, how can we still be there?" What is the difference between formal and non-establishment work?" After working for a short time, her thoughts changed. The cruel reality of society seemed to have taught her what life is.

;

;“Everything I have experienced and every change in society has definitely had an impact on me. And in the process, I am constantly thinking about the impact of each wave of the times. "Individual coercion," when these thoughts slowly accumulate, "you just want to express it." Sun Pin said.

;

;After graduating from university, Sun Pin successively published novel collections "Pain", "Salt" and "Crack". Many readers and critics noticed the pain of soul and spirit in his works. "Because you can only write about the pain if you really feel it, so I put high-concentration emotions into my early novels," Sun Pin said. As the title of the novel suggests, these creations reveal a young man's confrontation with society and the world, as well as his irreconcilable mental state.

;

;Looking back at her creations when she was in her twenties, Sun Pin felt that they were very normal and in line with a young person’s state of mind at that time and her understanding of the world. “When I didn’t understand society well enough, I walked into it. "Without society", what follows is the weakness and helplessness of individuals, as well as the rupture and impact when they suddenly fall from the ivory tower built by literature and education into reality and face life head-on.

;

;“It’s just that I can’t still burn my emotions as hard as I did when I was 20 years old at 40 years old. My novels when I was 20 years old focused on the deep and struggling hearts of young women. As I grow older, I will try to understand more people and pay attention to the wider world, which is interesting. Writers burn themselves throughout their lives, but later on, what I burn is no longer just emotions, It’s about a better understanding of this vast world.”

;

;While editing “In the Name of Birds and Beasts”, Fan Xiaozhe felt that Sun Pin “began to become more open-minded.” She believes, “In “Pain”, “Salt” and “Crack”, she paid more attention to individual pain, but starting from “In the Name of Birds and Beasts”, she combined some natural things, plants, mountains and rivers, including their backs The history of the world was brought out."

;

;Anthropological writing inspired her. In anthropology, Sun Pin saw a deeper and more contextual care for human beings. She wrote "In the Name of Birds and Beasts", using anthropological methods to deal with the changes in the mountains, the history of vegetation and mountains, and deeply describing the evolution of the lives of mountain people between the city and the mountains and forests. This persistent gaze on human beings and the world in which they live is full of patience and "the greatest respect for different people." And when she looked at these mountain people, fishermen and sea people with the same patience, these "wild" people in the eyes of urban civilization, she truly realized the unique vitality among them. In "The Rider of the White Horse" she wrote about all kinds of strange mountain people, the bachelor brothers who raised their adopted daughter together, the short man who ran a peasant university in the mountains... "You see, their living conditions are actually very difficult. You can also use the word barbaric to describe them," Sun Pin said, "but their language and their thoughts are full of vitality. That kind of vitality does not belong to cities and civilization, but it is equally sincere and moving."

;

;;

;

;Sun Pin collects scenery at the seaside of Xuwen's Bocheng Port;(provided by the interviewee/picture);

;

;Orientation A Wider World

;

;At the "Seaside Magician" new book sharing event, writer Li Jingze said: "Although Sun Pin's creation has changed a lot, I feel that her direction has not changed. There has always been an intention to establish a connection between people and all things, which is particularly important. A common situation in Sun Pin's novels is that as we walk, there are fewer and fewer people, and where there are few people, all things thrive."

;

;As he grew older, Sun Pin found that he was less interested in people. "When there is a lot of disappointment in people or human nature, or when one cannot find deep comfort in the crowd, this complex relationship between people will gradually become a cramped space that will constrain people."

;

;She got to know the plants and animals, the rivers she passed by, and tried to communicate with people who didn't speak Mandarin to try to understand them. "This itself is a very interesting process," Sun Pin said, "because you are gradually understanding the world, and this is actually very healing for people living in high-rise buildings." When she came to the mountains from the city Like the ocean, regional changes affect the state of mind of those who are in it. "You will become more and more tolerant."

;

;This change in the state of mind in life ultimately changed her creation. "My early novels were entangled in the relationships between people, and then I got a little tired of this kind of writing," Sun Pin said. "It doesn't make much sense to continue writing like this. I want to make some attempts and adjustments. Moreover, I think every writer’s attempt must have a premise that makes himself feel relaxed and happy, and has the function of healing and nourishing the author himself. It is impossible for a person to say that I write to do hard labor and write about those things. Things that I don’t want to write, even if it can bring more fame to the writer himself.”

;

;Sun Pin imagined himself becoming the fictional captain in “Seagull Rider”, trying to create a better , greater spiritual space - "Because writing itself is the healing and placement of oneself."

;

;"At that moment, I thought, if everything is really animistic, then a person After death, you just leave human society, but enter a broader world. In that world, plants, animals, mountains, rivers, sun, moon, oceans, hurricanes, gods, dead souls, monsters, and elves are all They can communicate with each other. This kind of communication cannot be seen by living people, but some traces are revealed in those who are lonely and traumatized..." (;"The Magician of the Sea";)

;

;"Escape and settlement exist at the same time," Sun Pin said, "You can understand this kind of escape as a result of people's Escape caused by the powerlessness of reality and the material world, but at the same time, in the process of escaping, you also construct a new world for yourself, a world that belongs to all things, no longer limited to human beings, but in the world of heaven and earth. Time."

;

;Questions still exist. Fan Xiaozhe believes that Sun Pin's creations always deal with her inner confusion. "First of all, she felt that communication between people in modern civilization is difficult, so she became confused." "In "Pain", "Salt" and " "In "Split", she started from her individual feelings and constantly wrote about confusion." "Later, she further inquired about the source of confusion. Is this a human problem or a social problem?"

;

;" At this stage, she did not look for answers among the crowd, but looked for them in all things." On the edge of modern civilization, in the depths of mountains, forests and islands that no one knows, those ships, sailors, mountain people, birds and beasts , are all self-consistent. "In all things, her confusion was diluted and alleviated, or healed."

;

;Sun Pin likes the "elf-like temperament" in Emily Dickinson's poems, and also likes Shen Congwen's poems. Writing, this kind of textual atmosphere is the state she yearns for, "In him, there is no trace of integration between human beings and all things in nature, very comfortable and natural stitching and connection."

;

;“Whistles sounded frequently at the scene, and a large number of police officers gathered together. They were wearing body armor, holding shields, and motorcycles. The sound of the car starting kept making a loud sound, and many people gathered around to watch."

;

;Recalling the scene a few days ago, the Nepali Mata still remembers it fresh.

;

;On November 23, 2023, thousands of people came to Kathmandu, Nepal, to hold a large-scale demonstration. "Restore the monarchy, abolish the republic," chanted protesters in Kathmandu, Nepal.

;

;According to local police estimates, about 9,000 people participated in the protest called by Durga Prasai, a former member of the Communist Party of Nepal (United Marxist-Leninist) and medical entrepreneur. Although police described the demonstration as "largely peaceful," two workers suffered minor injuries.

;

;Addressing the crowd later that afternoon, Prasai urged his supporters to break through the security cordon and march towards Maitigal. Police then used water cannon and tear gas to disperse the crowd.

;

;As political competition between the current republic and the pro-monarchy has intensified recently, the Nepali government has deployed about 10,000 security personnel from the Nepal Police, Armed Police Force and investigators to prevent the two groups from interfering. possible conflicts.

;

;The capital is "in chaos"

;

;Zhu Ming opened a restaurant in Nepal. He told Southern Weekend reporters that Nepal is an overall peaceful country, but in terms of certain political needs, Nepal There would be riots from time to time. Nowadays there are local police on every main street to maintain order.

;

;The young man Kariqi remembers clearly that the protest conflict took place at an intersection in the capital. People gathered and ran at the scene, and police sirens were heard continuously. “There was the sound of some kind of gunshots being fired, and there was an obvious Smoke Trail”.

;

;On that day, the local police fired 146 tear gas canisters and 5 rubber bullets to disperse Plase supporters in Barku.

;

;Plasse, who claims to be a maverick and has been adhering to anti-government and anti-corruption stances in recent times, said in a speech at the rally that Prime Minister Prachanda failed to rule the country and the country was heading towards bankruptcy and demanded that "He surrendered to the people."

;

;Plasse also claimed that his supporters would continue to hold protests elsewhere and would ignore Kathmandu's ban. Earlier, the government declared the Baneshwar stretch of Maiti as a no-go zone for protests. He said his campaign would not stop until the monarchy, the Hindu state and the 1990 constitution were restored.

;

;Plasse has long been considered a "controversial" businessman who is trying to overthrow Nepal's current government and calls the protests a "national rescue operation." He said the protests were against the government's failure to curb anarchy, corruption and rising inflation. Prashay wanted to restore the monarchy and the Hindu state by abolishing the current federal, republican and secular institutions.

;

;He also asked for the support of businessmen in the capital at the protest site, asking them to close their businesses from November 24.

;

;The youth wing of the Communist Party of Nepal (United Marxist-Leninist), the Rastiya Youth Party, and its student wing, the Nepal National Free Students Union, also participated in the demonstration in Tinkun. There are also many protesters who came to Kathmandu from the southern plains of Nepal. They are also "victims" of bank microfinance.

;

;Plasse said that banks are trying their best to exploit borrowers' money and called on people to give up their loans in banks.

;

;At the same time, demonstrators supporting the current republican regime also took to the streets. They believe that only a republic can guarantee social justice and equality and "allow everyone to have the opportunity to realize their dreams and pursuits."

;

;At the scene of the conflict, pro-monarchy protesters and counter-protesters clashed. The anger of the protesters spread from Barku, the designated protest area, to various areas such as Tinkunne, Garigaon, Sundara, Thapatali, Fudong and other key points.

;

;Subsequently, Kathmandu police arrested a total of 261 protesters, set up roadblocks and water cannons on the streets, and installed closed-circuit television to monitor Praset's supporters around the clock. Police have also deployed additional sniffer dogs around the conflict site and on rooftops to ensure safety and prevent possible incidents.

;

;In addition, in order to prevent conflicts between rival groups, the police designated two different protest areas. But the opposition between those who support the monarchy and those who support the republic is huge and will lead to heightened tensions.

;

;However, Zhu Ming said that the protests had little impact on local life. Because the protesters marched in designated areas, except for traffic closures during the march, other areas including the main business district and the World Tourist Center were not affected, and shops were open for business normally.

;

;Political systems in conflict

;

;Nepal, nestled in the Himalayas, has a rich and colorful culture, natural landscape and political history. But its political system evolved over the centuries, from a feudal monarchy to a federal democratic republic.

;

;Zeng Xiangyu, an associate researcher at the Institute of South Asia at Sichuan University, said that the current republic has indeed achieved certain positive results since its establishment, including the expansion of people's democratic rights and more protections.

;

;As early as the beginning of the 21st century, Nepalese politics underwent major changes. In 2006, Nepal's civil war ended and the government and rebels signed a peace agreement. Two years later, in 2008, Nepal officially declared itself a federal democratic republic, abolished the monarchy, the head of state became the president, and power was dispersed among the central government, federal state governments, and local governments.

;

;At the same time, the Nepali government began to formulate a new constitution and established a federal system. Nepal is divided into seven federal states, each of which has a certain degree of autonomy and is responsible for managing its own affairs. This constitution-making process went through many political crises and protests, but was finally adopted in 2015 and became the current constitution.

;

;“There are mainly two groups of people who are dissatisfied with the republic.” Zeng Xiangyu said that one group of people are young people who have grown up with modern education and have more expectations for the country. Another group of people are those who have experienced the monarchy era. They believe that although the monarchy has many shortcomings, politicians can at least compete within a limited range and achieve general stability.

;

;Zeng Xiangyu said that modern politics in Nepal is still in the process of being cultivated. The current chaos is not due to problems with the political system itself, but due to problems with the politician class, which leads to the operation of the current system. There are many problems and there is a lot of dissatisfaction.

;

;Political instability has plagued Nepal since the end of the monarchy, with more than a dozen changes of government.

;

;Zeng Xiangyu said that although there is currently no situation similar to previous civil wars in Nepal, the political arena has long been trapped in party disputes and the political situation has been unstable for a long time. Political parties continue to divide and change their policies, leaving voters disappointed. Voters hope to establish a stable government through elections and put the country on the right track, but politicians often use votes as bargaining chips in party political negotiations, causing strong dissatisfaction among voters.

;

;Politically unstable and economic development has slowed, millions of young people have left the country in search of work.

;

;Zeng Xiangyu told Southern Weekend reporters that Nepal’s economic development has been slowing down and the people are in an extremely confused and trapped state. Many people who study abroad or are active abroad are unwilling to come back. Some young people prefer to work in the Gulf or India.

;

;The recent protests have also shown the disputes and differences within Nepali society over the political system. Clearly, Nepali politics still faces some challenges and problems.

;

;Zhu Ming sometimes "chats" with protesters. He said the protesters' real demand was a return to the days of king power. "Because only the king will think about the people." He said that the protesters believe that no matter which party they are, they represent their own interests and will be bribed by different international forces.

;

;“There are many political forces in Nepal, behind which are the behind-the-scenes interest transactions of various political parties.” Zeng Xiangyu believes that although this is a shortcoming of the current republican system, it is different from the previous fierce confrontation or civil war era. Than, "It's always better".

;

;Are the "curry smell" protests effective?

;

;This is not the first time that conflicts and violent protests have occurred.

;

;Kathmandu police said that on the afternoon of September 7, 2023, 47-year-old Shyam Sapkota attacked Yadav, co-general secretary of the Nepali Congress Party, in Kathmandu. He suffered deep cuts on the back of his neck and was taken to hospital for treatment by police.

;

;After the incident, a video circulated on social media showed Sapkota shouting for the restoration of the country's monarchy.

;

;In December 2020, pro-monarchy and pro-Hindu activists marched on the streets of Kathmandu, demanding the restoration of the monarchy and Nepal as a Hindu country, and the abolition of the federal system.

;

;"Controversy over the constitutional system has always existed. It has been dragged on for many years and has not yet been completely resolved." Zeng Xiangyu said.

;

;It is noteworthy that Nepal is a multi-ethnic country, and there are tensions and differences between different ethnic and social groups. Some local people are dissatisfied with the federal demarcation and distribution of autonomy, which has led to protests and political unrest.

;

;Zeng Xiangyu analyzed that as a federal country in Nepal, the relationship between the central government and the provinces, as well as how to name the provinces and where the capital is located, are all issues that have caused huge controversy. "In the era of the king, there were As the controversial issue continues to this day, the controversy becomes even greater."

;

;Currently, Nepal's political status quo remains turbulent. There are serious differences in political philosophy between supporters of the monarchy and the republic. This opposition is not limited to ideology, but also involves the people's views on the future of the country.

;

;"Nepal's political parties, especially the mainstream political parties, are dividing and forming groups very quickly, and they focus entirely on political interests." Zeng Xiangyu commented that each political party does not regard specific policies that are beneficial to the country as its work Instead, he is keen on party struggle.

;

;Before the march, Zhu Ming asked those participating in the protest "whether they will succeed." The answer he got was "yes." But judging from the current results, "there is a high probability that it has not achieved its goal."

;

;Zeng Xiangyu said that Nepal’s political situation will not undergo major fluctuations due to this protest, and will continue on its original track. Several political parties are divided into groups, and for the sake of political interests, they will continue to "you sing and I will "Debut", there will be no major breakthroughs in economic and social development for the time being.

;

;“Democracy and republic cannot make mistakes.” Regarding this protest, Chairman of the Communist Party of Nepal (United Marxist-Leninist) Oli said that individual people in power may make mistakes, but this does not mean that the entire system is defective .

;

;Oli said the restoration of the monarchy was unthinkable. Just as humans cannot go back to the Stone Age, we cannot go back to monarchy.

;

;"The goals of the protesters are impossible to achieve." Zeng Xiangyu analyzed that the monarchy is a thing of the past and does not conform to the trend of the times. It is more of an emotional expression and a reflection of the status quo. protest. "It is almost impossible to achieve the goal of restoring the monarchy."

;

;However, this kind of protest may be an opportunity for Nepal.

;

;“This is a reminder to Nepal’s political class.” Zeng Xiangyu said, “More than ten years have passed, and the people will miss the monarchy and vent their dissatisfaction with the status quo, which is worthwhile in itself. Reflection. In Nepal, there are now some emerging political parties that represent the voices of young people and have achieved good results. But if they want to replace traditional political parties, they still have a long way to go."

;;2023-12-03 15:00:00;
;

;;

;

;At the beginning of this century, Wang Xiancai and his wife Zeng Hanying revisited their birthplace.

;

;My ancestral home is Yongan Township, Jiujiang County, Jiangxi Province. In the 1920s, my grandfather moved the family to Shanghai. In the 22nd year of the Republic of China (1933); the sixteenth day of the ninth lunar month, I was born in "Jianye Lane", Fululi Road, ;(now Jianguo West Road); in the French Concession in Shanghai. October 30, 2023 is my 90th birthday.

;

;When my wife Zeng Hanying and I revisited our former residence at the beginning of this century, Jianyeli had become a dilapidated building and was about to be demolished and rebuilt, and the residents had all moved out. The guard asked about the purpose of his visit and allowed me, an old resident, to go in and walk around, leaving this photo at the door of the alley.

;

;In the autumn of 1946, I returned to Jiujiang with my parents and lived in the ancestral house bought by my grandfather on Dutian Lane. It was an old house with two front and back floors. When Jiujiang was liberated in May 1949, I was a freshman in Tongwen Middle School. In the spring of 1951, when he was about to enter his junior year of high school, he was ordered to study at the Central South Youth League School in Wuhan ; (Jiangxi Province was then part of the Central South District);. When I returned from graduation in July, the Communist Youth League Committee asked me to stay in the student department and formally join the workforce. The pace of life slows down. I was not used to the life of a government cadre. At this time, the first unified entrance examination for colleges and universities across the country had passed. Suddenly I found that Shandong University School of Medicine had to recruit students separately, so I asked to resign and study further. The student minister agreed, but the organization minister believed that this was caused by bourgeois individualism, and he refused to obey the organization's decision and ordered him to "resign" from the group. This was the first political blow I suffered and became my “original sin.” People of insight believe that the ups and downs I experienced in the first half of my life were all related to this.

;

;After being forced to "resign" from the group, he bid farewell to his parents, sadly left home, and went to Qingdao to successfully enter the School of Medicine at Shanda University.

;

;;

;

;Registration photo for Shandong University.

;

;;Although I have never thought about studying medicine, I have to do this, otherwise I will have to wait another year. Later I discovered that this passively accepted major also protected me to a great extent. ;

;

;Because I paid a heavy price to get the opportunity to enter a higher education, I learned from the experience and worked harder than ever before. At that time, there were no textbooks in the university, so I mainly relied on taking notes during class. I listened attentively, requiring myself not only to understand, but also to remember in class. After class, I compiled notes from memory, and then supplemented them with Chinese and foreign materials I read in the library, so I learned more than what I heard in class. of more. I was the first in the class in every test score in all courses during college. Mr. Lu Yunming, professor of Physiology, made an exception and gave me 110 points on the 100% test paper because my answer exceeded what he taught in class. Thirty years later, I returned to Qingdao to attend the school anniversary event, and Mr. Lu happily mentioned this to me. Importantly, I also started my medical translation career at Shandong University.

;

;;

;

;While studying at Shandong University, I took photos on the Qingdao beachfront.

;

;After entering the clinical course, I learned that there is a world-renowned medical masterpiece "His Internal Medicine" in the United States. The teachers jokingly called it the "Das Kapital" of clinical medicine. I went to the school library to register and queue up, and borrowed this heavy masterpiece. While reading and studying, I was deeply impressed by its profoundness, systematic and rigorous discussion, and its emphasis on the connection between clinical and basic theory, so I came up with the idea of ​​translating it into Chinese. I think this is a very meaningful thing.

;

;A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step. I want to do it in two steps: first translate a smaller book, and then move on to that big book after gaining experience. Later, I chose "An Approach to Clinical Surgery;" (;An Approach to Clinical Surgery;) written by Professor HC Owens of the United Kingdom for interns and junior residents. I felt that the content of this book was It's something I can control.

;

;However, whether I wanted to translate "His Internal Medicine" or tried to translate this booklet, it was still a secret of mine at that time. There was only one close friend in the same class;(Liu Piren);Knowing this, he has always been optimistic about me and encouraged me, and even found a "secret" translation place for me, which is the small building on the roof of the third surgical ward. attic. It was a low, cramped small room covered with cobwebs and dust. I had to bend down to get in. The "tables" are stacked soap boxes, sitting on bricks wrapped in newspaper. I get up early every morning and hide here to translate books. There was no electricity in the attic, so candles were the only way to light it. My eyesight is not good. When I look closely, I often smell a burning smell, which means my hair is burning. I work until six or seven o'clock and quietly return to the dormitory, keeping up with the rhythm of life of my classmates, washing, eating, and going to the ward together.

;

;;

;

;Photos from the time when I was secretly translating books in the attic.

;

;I kept a low profile and did a good job of keeping it secret. Until I finished translating this little book of more than 200,000 words, no one discovered my "underground activities." In 1993, I returned to Qingdao to attend the anniversary event of my alma mater. Liu Jingru, my classmate who lived in the bunk below me, ;(then the director of the Qingdao Municipal Health Bureau);Admitted that he had no idea about these activities of mine at that time.

;

;;

;

;In 1993, he returned to Qingdao Medical University to participate in the school anniversary event and took a photo with his old classmate Liu Jingru (middle), who was the director of the Qingdao Health Bureau at the time.

;

;When "Instructions for Clinical Surgery" was published by Shanghai Health Publishing House in 1957, I had already graduated and was working in Beijing.

;

;;

;

;After this little book was published, I went through many ups and downs and almost lost everything. This is a used book I bought online. I accidentally found it on a used book website. At least it is still good. There have been three reprints: Shanghai Science and Technology Press (1960, 1961) and Hong Kong Commercial Press (1970).

;

;Enter "His"

;

;The publication of "Instructions for Clinical Surgery" gave me great encouragement. I bought back the 9th edition of "His Internal Medicine" and began to It marches on. This translation is not an "underground activity". My colleagues all know that I am doing it. But I was unlucky, and soon the anti-rightist movement came. Although I got through 1957, the year when I became famous, safely, because the hospital's anti-rightist goals were not fulfilled, in June 1958, I was still classified as a rightist for "unreasonable opinions" on Soviet medicine. By this time, the anti-rightist climax had passed, and I and two other right-wing recruits were not sent out. We stayed in the hospital to supervise labor and were given a monthly living allowance of 32 yuan.

;

;Two months later, the hospital was suddenly ordered to move to Hohhot, Inner Mongolia to support the local Great Leap Forward. The pressure I feel is also increasing. Finally, on a bright and clear night, the translated manuscript of the 9th edition of "His", about 400,000 words, was burned in a wasteland next to the hospital. Although I felt very miserable, I could still convince myself: now is not the time to translate books, and I must first try to take off this "hat" on my head. Science is always evolving, and a new version will come out when the time comes, and I will start over.    

;

;Since 1960, I have been ordered to act as "acting attending physician". Every morning, I lead the residents and interns on ward rounds. At this time, I am their superior. After the ward rounds, they return to the office and I sweep the floor, clean the tables, and empty the toilets for the patients. Whatever patients need me to do and I can do, I do it proactively. Because I am different from them, I am a right-winger under supervision. At that time, they were the enemies of the people, the "reactionaries". So what I think about day and night and think about in my heart is "taking off my hat".

;

;Looking forward to the stars, looking forward to the moon, and finally looking forward to this day. In November 1961, the Party Committee of the Academy announced that I would be "retired". At this time, the situation also changed a lot: the Soviet Union became the "Soviet revisionist" and the target of our criticism, and was no longer the "big brother". I returned to my old business, bought the 11th edition of "His", and started to study "His" again.

;

;But as luck would have it, the "Four Cleanups" movement came again. The leader of the working group leading the movement warned me: Don’t relapse, as the “rightist” label can be put back on again after you take it off! These words hit home for me. I have to pull back from the brink! Finally, the re-translated 11th edition of the manuscript of "His" ; (also more than 400,000 words); was placed next to the hospital. The wasteland was set on fire.

;

;A famous person once said that the most painful thing in life is waking up from a dream with no way out. When I am wearing the "hat", I can dream about doing it again after taking off the "hat". What path can I take now, what can I dream about?

;

;Life is sometimes cruel but also interesting: more than twenty years later, I was invited to return to Hohhot. When I was discussing with scientific and technical personnel in the Inner Mongolia Science and Technology Building, I discovered that this building is the same hospital where I used to work. Next, it was built on the wasteland where I burned manuscripts twice. I couldn’t help but tell them about this past event.

;

;Upgrade again

;

;The "Four Clean-ups" movement has not yet completely ended, but it has entered a decade of catastrophe. I was punished as a "rightist without hats" and upgraded to an "active counterrevolutionary". I was sentenced to 12 years in prison, deprived of political rights for 4 years, and entered a labor camp. Fortunately, the authorities took advantage of my skills and allowed me to serve my sentence in the health department of the labor camp, avoiding regular labor.

;

;In 1971, Cheng Dalu, a fellow prisoner who was released after serving his sentence, gave me a tightly wrapped "gift". When I opened it, I saw that it was the 13th edition of "His Internal Medicine"! Cheng Dalu was an educated youth from Shanghai who was transferred to Shanxi. He was sentenced to five years in prison for "counterrevolutionary" crimes. He was hospitalized here for a long time because of pleurisy. We get along well. He knew that I was determined to translate "His Internal Medicine" and kept it in mind. At that time, it was stipulated that people who lived in big cities and along the coast could not go home after release and had to stay in the factory >;Employment. So he could take advantage of the fact that every day after the prisoners went to work and there were no guards in the cell, he could send me books. Cheng Dalu only has a "salary" of 29 yuan per month, and he also has to support his younger sister who is sent to Anhui. But after he discovered the newly released "His Internal Medicine" (photocopy) in a foreign language bookstore, he tried every means and sold his clothes to buy it for me.

;

;;

;

;In 1984, we met again after the robbery on Hechengda Road in Jiujiang (left in the picture).

;

;Suddenly I saw the long-lost "He", things have changed and people have changed, and the feeling in my heart is really indescribable.

;

;After the prisoners go to work every day, they eat lunch at the construction site and do not return from work until 6 p.m. So I can read a book after I finish handling the affairs in the ward in the morning, and I can calm down by eight or nine o'clock after I finish handling the patients sent by each team for consultation in the evening. I looked through the 13th edition of "His" and found that with the advancement of the times, the content is very different from previous editions. His Majesty himself has long since retired. ;Being let down, betrayed, and deceived by friends can have many endings - such as "stabbing in the back", such as when I Nearly 30 years ago, I lent a large sum of money to my best friend, but it was never repaid. This money was supposed to be used to prepare me for big things. But there are very few people who are as miserable as Zhu Dan and have no friends.

;

;Recently, Zhu Dan revealed when participating in a program that he was defrauded of all his savings by a friend many years ago. She was deceived by her friend into being a debt guarantor and wrote her name on a blank piece of paper. As a result, she was forced to use all her savings to pay off all her friend's debts. Even if he won the lawsuit, the matter would end in Zhu Dan's misfortune because his shameless friend declared "bankruptcy."

;

;How much this money is, many people are concerned about this issue.

;

;Because the parties did not disclose specific figures, it is impossible to confirm. But this is not important, because we only need to know that this amount of money is beyond the imagination of ordinary people. The important thing is that this incident happened while Zhu Dan and Yiwei Yiwei were in love, but Yiwei Yi chose to repay the debt with Zhu Dan. In the program, when Zhu Dan recounted this unbearable event in a calm tone with red eyes under the wind chimes, Yiwei Yiwei looked at her with a distressed and forgiving look, as if he were facing a child who had been wronged. This scene It’s very emotional.

;

;I believe that many people have met people who do things without thinking, otherwise there would be so many "easy to deceive people" in the world. How stupid is Zhu Dan's hasty behavior? As one netizen said, your behavior as a human being should not be too outrageous, and you must have a basic bottom line. Zhu Dan's best friend sent her a piece of white paper, and she dared to sign it. It was difficult for a middle school student to do this. Even the judge couldn't help "teaching" Zhu Dan that he was legally illiterate. As long as he signed on the white paper, It is equivalent to admitting everything on this piece of paper.

;

;This netizen said that he does not have such a wife, but he has such a mother. These words also touched the sensitive parts of many people's hearts. I have relatives and friends who are like this. They don't listen to anything they say, and they only wake up after being deceived. However, it doesn't take long for them to fall into new routines again. As the saying goes, "Dangdang is different", some people just can't get out of this tragic scam "reincarnation". What can you do? Anyway, I heard that in addition to some parents "paying the bill" for their deceived children, there are many examples of couples breaking up.

;

;So I very much agree with what this netizen said: Yiwei Yi helped her pay off the debt. This behavior cannot be described as high-spirited and upright.

;

;In other words, Yiwei Yi seems to be indifferent to Zhu Dan, which is one of the reasons why some "black fans" have been criticizing Yiwei. Not only do they feel that Yiwei is not good to Zhu Dan, but they also habitually show off in public places. The "poker-faced" Zhou Yiwei got a lot of insults on his head. There are even rumors that the two are getting married. But now, many netizens woke up from the misunderstanding and discovered that Yiwei Yiwei is so good - "I apologize for talking about Yiwei before. If he can avoid divorce after such a thing, I respect him as a real man." "We endure hardships and enjoy happiness together." "There are not many people who can repay debts together. And it's a man, even less." "I thought he was quite shrewd, and it seemed like he was in love. I thought this kind of thing could only be done by parents to their children." "Come out" "Yiwei Zhou is a relatively aloof but loyal type".

;

;You know, at that time Yiwei could have broken up with Zhu Dan without having to sacrifice himself. Even if the two are already married, Yiwei Yi has every reason to ignore the "bad debt". After all, even according to the marriage law, it is not his responsibility.

;

;Zhu Dan was tricked by his friends, which is a typical example of being defrauded. According to legal principles, whether you have an obligation to repay debts caused by being defrauded depends on whether the debts are used jointly by the husband and wife. Unless there is evidence to prove that the debt belongs to the couple's common living use, the other party has no obligation and responsibility to repay it. Those who say this, and those who believe this, can also pay 10 million or 20 million for someone to treat you as a "master" and see if you are willing?

;It is really sad to see people without knowing their surroundings. We should feel lucky to still have such a kind and loving man like Yiwei Yi in our sight.

;

;It is precisely because of the old saying that "husband and wife are originally birds of the same forest, and they fly separately when disaster strikes", acts of friendship are particularly noble. If a couple wants to maintain a long-term relationship, it is not enough to just have an emotional foundation. In a world that is difficult and full of changes, if there is a lack of moral support and a little noble personality from both parties, it is not surprising that the couple breaks up halfway.

;In the recently launched animated series "PLUTO" by Netflix, the audience once again saw the familiar robot Astro Boy from their childhood. This animated work depicts the existential crisis of humans and robots after the Central Asian War. The information is dense, neat and compact, and its lightness is as impressive as its heaviness.

;

;Hideo Kojima, the game producer and a well-known science fiction fan and animation fan, said, "This work is completely different from robot animations and hero animations that can only fight. This is Japanese manga (;Comics;), this is animation."

;

;The birth of ChatGPT made mankind realize that it may be replaced in the new technological environment Species crisis, the Palestinian-Israeli conflict caused tragic casualties. In this reality, "PLUTO" appeared: the shadow of the post-war period shrouded the entire earth, and Persia, which had lost its country, created the giant robot Pluto and wanted to destroy him. Seven of the world's strongest robots, including Astro Boy. In the fictional story, "war robot crisis" replaces "nuclear crisis", and "robot sanctions" replace "nuclear sanctions" in international politics.

;

;In 1964, Japanese cartoonist Osamu Tezuka released the special "Astro Boy" episode "The Strongest Robot on Earth". From the 1950s to the 1970s when Japanese comics were on the rise, most cartoonists of Tezuka’s generation took a left-leaning political stance because of their experience in World War II. They were anti-war, respectful of life, and advocating equality in their works.

;

;In 2003, with the permission of Osamu Tezuka's son, cartoonist Naoki Urasawa created "PLUTO" based on "The Strongest Robot on Earth". "PLUTO", born in 2023, is an animated series created by Netflix on this basis. From the anti-war thoughts in 1964, to the Iraq War in 2003, to the Palestinian-Israeli conflict in 2023, the three creations of "PLUTO" correspond to the war backgrounds of different eras.

;

;Japan has long allowed the world to accept the artistic language of comics. Tokiwa-so cartoonists headed by Osamu Tezuka have redefined the depth and breadth of comics. Their depiction and exploration of emotions have made their works Crossing the boundaries of the audience. Although "PLUTO" takes place in the context of a grand robot war, its setting is still classical: How can a robot become more like a human? On the one hand, humans are afraid of being replaced by machines; on the other hand, they are full of discrimination against androids - humans have emotions, and robots are just inferior species.

;

;Robot, are you really not sad? When robots cry, even they themselves are surprised. Who am I? Am I really grieving? Are these reactions emotions, or a set of codes?

;

;While watching this animation, I needed to press the pause button several times and stop for a while. Its perception and depiction of emotions are very innocent and beautiful, and sadness comes in an extremely light way. When Astro Boy is destroyed, will he be allowed to declare "death"? Or it can only be declared "damaged and scrapped". Naoki Urasawa continues Tetsuka's exploration of "the relationship between man and others", and still almost stubbornly depicts the possibility of "understanding" in a world full of fragmentation and disputes. For example, the robot North 2 went to the hometown of a stubborn artist to find the piano music in the artist's dream; the dinner between the robot Astro Boy and Dr. Pegasus; Ulan, who lost Astro Boy, could not face his own perception. The little robot keeps running around, trying to help sad humans.

;

;I haven’t seen such an animated work for a long time. The last time it gave me such an emotional experience was the animated film "Ghost in the Shell". Its English name is "Ghost in the Shell". Those whispers in the machine body may be just ghosts that are difficult to define, but it happened after all, didn't it?
